Operation 'Upsert' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary 'Upsert' is too vague and not action-oriented. Description lacks critical details about inputs (batch format, metadata support), outputs (return value), and side effects (overwrites existing data, namespace scoping, batch behavior). Enhanced version clarifies the operation's dual nature (create/update), specifies what data is overwritten, explains input structure, clarifies return value, and notes namespace isolation for better AI agent decision-making about when to use this operation.

data.current_description: The Upsert operation writes vectors into a namespace. If a new value is upserted for an existing vector id, it will overwrite the previous value.
data.summary_suggestion: Write or update vectors in a namespace
data.description_suggestion: Writes vectors into a specified namespace, creating new vector entries or updating existing ones. If a vector with the same ID already exists, its dense data, sparse data, and metadata will be overwritten with the provided values. Accepts a batch of vectors with IDs, dense/sparse data, and optional metadata. Returns the count of successfully upserted vectors. Operates within a single namespace and supports partial batch failures.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Upsert' is too vague and not action-oriented. Description lacks critical details about inputs (batch format, metadata support), outputs (return value), and side effects (overwrites existing data, namespace scoping, batch behavior). Enhanced version clarifies the operation's dual nature (create/update), specifies what data is overwritten, explains input structure, clarifies return value, and notes namespace isolation for better AI agent decision-making about when to use this operation.

message: Operation 'create_collection' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description is too minimal. Missing critical details about required inputs (CollectionDefinition structure), what is returned (collection object with metadata), and side effects (collection availability). Enhanced description helps AI agents understand prerequisites and outcomes.

data.current_description: This operation creates a Pinecone collection.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Pinecone collection from a collection definition. Requires a CollectionDefinition object specifying the collection name and source index. Returns the created collection object with metadata including creation timestamp and status. The collection becomes available for use immediately after creation.
data.reasoning: Description is too minimal. Missing critical details about required inputs (CollectionDefinition structure), what is returned (collection object with metadata), and side effects (collection availability). Enhanced description helps AI agents understand prerequisites and outcomes.

message: Operation 'describe_collection' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original description lacks specificity about inputs and outputs. Added clarity about the required collectionName parameter, what metadata is returned, and practical use cases. Helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

data.current_description: Get a description of a collection.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific collection by name. Requires the collection name as a path parameter. Returns a Collection object containing metadata such as the source index, creation timestamp, status, and vector count. Useful for verifying collection configuration and status.
data.reasoning: Original description lacks specificity about inputs and outputs. Added clarity about the required collectionName parameter, what metadata is returned, and practical use cases. Helps AI agents understand when to use this operation and what to expect.

message: Operation 'delete_collection' has semantic quality issues: missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Description lacks critical details about the required parameter, return value, and important side effects (irreversibility). Enhanced description emphasizes the destructive nature of this operation and helps AI agents understand the consequences and requirements.

data.current_description: This operation deletes an existing collection.
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes a collection by name. Requires the collection name as a path parameter. This operation is irreversible and will remove all collection metadata. Returns a 204 No Content response on successful deletion. Ensure the collection is no longer needed before deletion.
data.reasoning: Description lacks critical details about the required parameter, return value, and important side effects (irreversibility). Enhanced description emphasizes the destructive nature of this operation and helps AI agents understand the consequences and requirements.

message: Operation 'create_index' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. While the description mentions configurable parameters, it lacks clarity about what is returned and the side effect of index initialization. Enhanced description specifies the return value and clarifies that the index requires initialization time before use, helping AI agents understand the complete operation lifecycle.

data.current_description: This operation creates a Pinecone index. You can use it to specify the measure of similarity, the dimension of vectors to be stored in the index, the numbers of replicas to use, and more.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new Pinecone index with specified configuration. Accepts an IndexDefinition object to configure the similarity metric (e.g., cosine, euclidean, dotproduct), vector dimensionality, number of replicas, pod type, and other parameters. Returns the created index object with metadata including status and configuration. The index becomes available for vector operations once initialization completes.
data.reasoning: While the description mentions configurable parameters, it lacks clarity about what is returned and the side effect of index initialization. Enhanced description specifies the return value and clarifies that the index requires initialization time before use, helping AI agents understand the complete operation lifecycle.

data.current_description: Get a description of an index.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed information about a specific index by name. Requires the index name as a path parameter. Returns an Index object containing metadata such as dimension, similarity metric, pod type, number of replicas, vector count, index status, and usage statistics. Useful for verifying index configuration and monitoring resource utilization.

message: Operation 'delete_index' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_side_effects. The current description is too minimal and lacks critical information about the destructive nature of this operation. AI agents need to understand the permanence and scope of deletion (all vectors, metadata, namespaces) to avoid accidental data loss. Added authentication context for completeness.

data.current_description: This operation deletes an existing index.
data.description_suggestion: Deletes an existing index and all associated data. This operation permanently removes the index specified by indexName, including all vectors, metadata, and namespaces within it. This action cannot be undone. Requires appropriate API key authentication.
data.reasoning: The current description is too minimal and lacks critical information about the destructive nature of this operation. AI agents need to understand the permanence and scope of deletion (all vectors, metadata, namespaces) to avoid accidental data loss. Added authentication context for completeness.

message: Operation 'configure_index' has semantic quality issues: vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original description only lists what can be configured but doesn't explain the effects or outcomes. data.current_description: This operation specifies the pod type and number of replicas for an index.
data.description_suggestion: Modifies the pod type and replica configuration of an existing index. Updates the index's infrastructure settings including pod type and replica count. Changes take effect immediately and may cause temporary unavailability during reconfiguration. Returns the updated index configuration. Existing vectors and metadata are preserved.
data.reasoning: Original description only lists what can be configured but doesn't explain the effects or outcomes. Added information about immediate effect, potential temporary unavailability, return value, and data preservation to help AI agents understand the operational impact.

Improved to be more action-oriented and specific. Description needed clarification about what statistics are returned and the required input (index name) for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: The `DescribeIndexStats` operation returns statistics about the index's contents, including the vector count per namespace and the number of dimensions.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve index statistics and vector counts
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves detailed statistics about an index's contents and structure. Returns vector count per namespace, total vector count, dimension count, and index size information. Useful for monitoring index health and capacity. Requires the index name to be specified in the request.
data.reasoning: Summary was too generic ('Describe Index Stats'). Improved to be more action-oriented and specific. Description needed clarification about what statistics are returned and the required input (index name) for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'Query' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary was too vague. Description lacked input details (filter, top-k parameters) and output details (optional metadata/vector data return). Enhanced to clarify what inputs are accepted, how results are ranked, and what can be returned to help AI agents construct proper queries.

data.current_description: The `Query` operation searches a namespace, using a query vector. It retrieves the ids of the most similar items in a namespace, along with their similarity scores.
data.summary_suggestion: Search for similar vectors by query vector
data.description_suggestion: Searches a namespace for vectors most similar to a query vector using the index's configured similarity metric. Accepts a query vector (dense and/or sparse), optional metadata filter, and top-k parameter. Returns the IDs of the most similar vectors, their similarity scores, and optionally their metadata and vector data. Results are ranked by similarity score in descending order.
data.reasoning: Summary was too vague. Description lacked input details (filter, top-k parameters) and output details (optional metadata/vector data return). Enhanced to clarify what inputs are accepted, how results are ranked, and what can be returned to help AI agents construct proper queries.

message: Operation 'Delete' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_context, missing_output_details. Summary was too generic. Description was repetitive and lacked important details about filter support, return value, and metadata handling. Clarified that multiple vectors can be deleted, filters can be applied, and explained the side effect of metadata removal.

data.current_description: The `Delete` operation deletes vectors, by id, from a single namespace. You can delete items by their id, from a single namespace.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete vectors by ID from namespace
data.description_suggestion: Deletes one or more vectors from a specified namespace by their vector IDs. Accepts a list of vector IDs and an optional metadata filter to selectively delete vectors. Vectors matching the IDs (and filter if provided) are permanently removed. Returns confirmation of deletion. Metadata associated with deleted vectors is also removed.
data.reasoning: Summary was too generic. Description was repetitive and lacked important details about filter support, return value, and metadata handling. Clarified that multiple vectors can be deleted, filters can be applied, and explained the side effect of metadata removal.

message: Operation 'Fetch' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary was too vague. Description lacked clarity about input parameters (list of IDs, optional return controls) and didn't explain behavior for missing vectors. Enhanced to clarify multiple vector retrieval, optional return parameters, and handling of non-existent IDs.

data.current_description: The `Fetch` operation looks up and returns vectors, by ID, from a single namespace. The returned vectors include the vector data and/or metadata.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve vectors by ID from namespace
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves one or more vectors from a specified namespace by their vector IDs. Accepts a list of vector IDs and optional parameters to control what data is returned. Returns the requested vectors with their IDs, vector data (dense values), sparse data if present, and associated metadata. Non-existent vector IDs are silently skipped.
data.reasoning: Summary was too vague. Description lacked clarity about input parameters (list of IDs, optional return controls) and didn't explain behavior for missing vectors. Enhanced to clarify multiple vector retrieval, optional return parameters, and handling of non-existent IDs.

message: Operation 'Update' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, inconsistent_terminology, missing_output_details. Summary incorrectly said 'Fetch' instead of 'Update'. Description used inconsistent terminology ('set_metadata' parameter name) and lacked clarity about partial update behavior and return value. Corrected summary, clarified update semantics (complete replacement for vectors, merge for metadata), and added return value information for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_description: The `Update` operation updates vector in a namespace. If a value is included, it will overwrite the previous value. If a set_metadata is included, the values of the fields specified in it will be added or overwrite the previous value.
data.description_suggestion: Updates one or more vectors in a specified namespace. Supports updating vector values (dense and/or sparse data) and metadata fields. Vector values, if provided, completely replace existing values. Metadata fields specified in the update are added or overwritten; unspecified fields are preserved. Returns confirmation of successful updates. Partial updates are supported - only provided fields are modified.
data.reasoning: Summary incorrectly said 'Fetch' instead of 'Update'. Description used inconsistent terminology ('set_metadata' parameter name) and lacked clarity about partial update behavior and return value. Corrected summary, clarified update semantics (complete replacement for vectors, merge for metadata), and added return value information for better AI agent understanding.
